availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Gaylord McFall (Richland County, Ohio, merchant and soldier)

body.p: Richland County, Ohio, merchant and soldier. Ohio native. Son of Hugh McFall and Clarissa McFall. Married Mary H. Cummings McFall in Richland County, Ohio, on September 17, 1851. Father of Minnie McFall and Walter McFall. Married to Mary E. Hamilton McFall in Richland County, Ohio, on February 4, 1862. Merchant in Madison, Ohio in 1850. Merchant in Mansfield, Ohio in 1860. Served in the McLaughinâ€™s Squadron Ohio Cavalry (U.S.A). as captain and major in 1862.
